title: What is the definition and significance of the financial system? - Quora

response.answer_text: A financial system is a system that allows the exchange of funds between lenders, investors, and borrowers. Financial systems operate at national, global, and firm-specific levels. Financial institutions provide financial services for members and clients. It is also termed as financial intermediaries because they act as middlemen between the savers and borrowers. Significance: The financial system and the banks in a country play a crucial role in the economy's use of currency. Banks run the payment systems that enable local markets to operate and individuals and companies to travel to distant places and act there.

The economic system of a nation is depicted by the Circular flow model of economy whose fundamental islands of transition or nodes on a directed graph are, government, manufacturing, banking and households. The fundamental interaction between these islands are driven by doctrines of taxes, production, marketing, investments, profits, interest rates, credits etc; in a direction basis of transition. The budget, the national output accounting or gdp(debit) and national income accounting(credit), capital formation accounting, depict the financial system or activity of the nation. The balance of payment accounting depict the foreign market finances of the nation.
